FuncDef:
The reset access statistics packet discard mac-spoofing command clears statistics about MAC-spoofing-dropped packets of access users.
The reset access statistics packet discard urpf command clears statistics about URPF-dropped packets of access users.
CLIs: reset access statistics packet discard { mac-spoofing | urpf } [ ipoe | pppoe ] [ ipv4 | ipv6 ] { interface { <interface-type> <interface-name> | <interface-number> } | slot <slot-id> }

ParaDef.Info:
Clears statistics about MAC-spoofing-dropped packets of access users.
-

Clears statistics about URPF-dropped packets of access users.
-

Clears statistics about URPF-dropped packets of IPoX users.
-

Clears statistics about URPF-dropped packets of PPPoX users.
-

Clears statistics about MAC-spoofing-dropped IPv4 packets.
-

Clears statistics about MAC-spoofing-dropped IPv6 packets.
-

Specifies the type and number of an interface.
-

Examples: <HUAWEI> reset access statistics packet discard urpf slot 1
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
Before collecting statistics about MAC-spoofing-dropped packets over a specified period, run the reset access statistics packet discard mac-spoofing command to clear the existing statistics.
Before collecting statistics about URPF-dropped packets over a specified period, run the reset access statistics packet discard urpf command to clear the existing statistics.
Configuration Impact
Statistics about MAC-spoofing-dropped packets cannot be restored after they are cleared. Exercise caution when running this command.
Statistics about URPF-dropped packets cannot be restored after they are cleared. Exercise caution when running this command.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
